description.narrative:
Stakeholder impact: IFC will support investments focused on sewage expansion and water quality improvements in the state of São Paulo.
Market impact: The use of performance-based contract as part of the Pinheiros River Cleanup Program demonstrates an innovative contractual model that can be used as reference for other water and sanitation companies to increase efficiency in meeting coverage targets, while boosting the sectors competitiveness.

The proposed transaction consists of an A Loan for the BRL equivalent of up to US$150 million to Companhia de Saneamento Básico do Estado de São Paulo - SABESP (SABESP or the Company). SABESP is a water and sanitation service provider operating in the state of São Paulo and supplying approximately 27.8 million people with water and 24.6 million people with sewage collection. The A Loan will have a 10-year tenor and the proceeds will be used to finance investments in water and sanitation infrastructure in the state of São Paulo (the Project).
